title: N06-1037

sentences.text: This paper proposes to use a convolution kernel over parse trees to model syntactic structure information for relation extraction .
Our study reveals that the syntactic structure features embedded in a parse tree are very effective for relation extraction and these features can be well captured by the convolution tree kernel .

Evaluation on the ACE 2003 corpus shows that the convolution kernel over parse trees can achieve comparable performance with the previous best-reported feature-based methods on the 24 ACE relation subtypes .
It also shows that our method significantly outperforms the previous two dependency tree kernels on the 5 ACE relation major types .

summary: This paper proposes to use a convolution kernel over parse trees to model syntactic structure information for relation extraction . Our study reveals that the syntactic structure features embedded in a parse tree are very effective for relation extraction and these features can be well captured by the convolution tree kernel . Evaluation on the ACE 2003 corpus shows that the convolution kernel over parse trees can achieve comparable performance with the previous best-reported feature-based methods on the 24 ACE relation subtypes . It also shows that our method significantly outperforms the previous two dependency tree kernels on the 5 ACE relation major types .

Predicate-proposes_to_use.label: proposes to use
Predicate-proposes_to_use.description: The predicate 'proposes to use' indicates a plan or intention to employ a particular method, technique, or tool (object), as described by the subject. It suggests that the subject has considered and recommends using the object for a specific purpose.

Predicate-model.label: model
Predicate-model.description: The predicate 'model' represents a conceptual representation or abstraction of its subject that captures essential characteristics and patterns from its object. It implies a process of learning, inference, or generalization that enables the subject to capture relevant information about the object.

Predicate-proposes_to_use_a_convolution_.label: proposes to use a convolution kernel over parse trees
Predicate-proposes_to_use_a_convolution_.description: To employ a specific machine learning technique that leverages the structural properties of natural language text by applying convolutional operations over parse trees, with the goal of extracting or modeling certain information.

Predicate-are_very_effective_for.label: are very effective for
Predicate-are_very_effective_for.description: The predicate 'are very effective for' indicates a relationship between the subject and object where the subject's characteristics or properties make it suitable or well-suited for achieving, accomplishing, or facilitating the object. In general, this predicate suggests that the subject has the necessary qualities to be useful or successful in relation to the object.

Predicate-can_be_well_captured_by.label: can be well captured by
Predicate-can_be_well_captured_by.description: This predicate indicates that the subject's inherent characteristics or properties are accurately represented or modeled by the object. The object serves as a means of capturing or describing the essential features of the subject, often in a concise and effective manner.

Predicate-reveals_that_the_syntactic_str.label: reveals that the syntactic structure features embedded in a parse tree are very effective for relation extraction and these features can be well captured by
Predicate-reveals_that_the_syntactic_str.description: The predicate 'reveals' connects the subject to an explanation or demonstration of how a particular set of syntactic structure features embedded in a parse tree can be effective for relation extraction, and further indicates that these features can be well captured by a specific method or technique.

Predicate-shows_that.label: shows that
Predicate-shows_that.description: The predicate 'shows that' indicates a relationship between the subject and object where the subject provides evidence or demonstrates something about the object. It suggests that the subject has some inherent property, characteristic, or quality that can be inferred from its connection to the object.

Predicate-can_achieve_comparable_perform.label: can achieve comparable performance with
Predicate-can_achieve_comparable_perform.description: This predicate indicates that the subject has a level of proficiency or effectiveness equivalent to that of the object. It suggests a comparison between the two entities, implying that they share similar qualities or abilities.

Predicate-achieve_comparable_performance.label: achieve comparable performance on
Predicate-achieve_comparable_performance.description: To indicate that a subject achieves similar or equivalent results as those previously reported for a specific object. This predicate suggests a comparison between the subject's performance and the existing best-reported performance on the given task, domain, or problem.

Predicate-outperforms.label: outperforms
Predicate-outperforms.description: Indicates that one entity or method surpasses another in terms of performance, quality, or effectiveness.

Predicate-used_in.label: used in
Predicate-used_in.description: The predicate 'used in' indicates a relationship where the subject (a method or technique) has been applied to achieve or accomplish something described by the object. The connection between the subject and object suggests that the subject's purpose, function, or utility lies within the scope of the object.

Predicate-significantly_outperforms_the_.label: significantly outperforms the previous two dependency tree kernels on the 5 ACE relation major types
Predicate-significantly_outperforms_the_.description: The predicate indicates that the subject has a superior performance compared to previously used methods (the previous two dependency tree kernels), specifically in terms of capturing certain relationship types (5 ACE relation major types).

Predicate-proposes.label: proposes
Predicate-proposes.description: To propose something means to suggest or recommend it as a solution, idea, or plan. The predicate 'proposes' indicates that the subject (typically an entity with authority or expertise) presents and advocates for the object (an idea, concept, or approach), often in order to initiate discussion, consideration, or implementation.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject is a specific instance or example of a more general category or concept represented by the object. The relationship between the subject and object is one of instantiation, where the subject is a concrete realization of the abstract idea or class denoted by the object.
